definition: to blurt out
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
diction/enunciation
(loanword) talk show/stand-up comedy

sentences.english: Cui Yongyuan is a famous talk show host .
sentences.chinese: 崔永元是著名的脫口秀主持人。

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 300 sentences, you can make a living in America.
sentences.chinese: 脫口而出300句英語，你可以在美國工作。

sentences.english: If we had another name for this meat, people wouldn't even think twice.
sentences.chinese: 你若問起這種肉的別名，人們想都不想就會脫口而出。

sentences.english: The whole idea evolved from a casual remark.
sentences.chinese: 整個想法是由一句脫口而出的話演變而來的。

sentences.english: One day Cosette chanced to say "father" to him.
sentences.chinese: 有一天珂賽特脫口叫了他一聲“父親”。

sentences.english: As a result, networks will be rerunning some late-night talk shows and soap operas.
sentences.chinese: 結果是，網絡將播放一些午夜脫口秀和肥皂劇。

sentences.english: Every day I am blurting out more sentences.
sentences.chinese: 每一天，我都在脫口而出更多的句子。

sentences.english: Emotional when the mirror will be almost blurted out the true identity of the Ming house.
sentences.chinese: 情緒激動之時，明鏡險些將明樓的真實身份脫口而出。

sentences.english: That show was renamed "The Oprah Winfrey Show" in 1985.
sentences.chinese: 這檔節目在1985年改名爲《奧普拉脫口秀》。

sentences.english: The comedian's ad-libs were quoted in the newspaper.
sentences.chinese: 那喜劇演員的脫口妙語被引述在報紙上。

sentences.english: I think talk shows are non-sense.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲脫口秀一點意思也沒有。

sentences.english: Julia blurted out by accident. “I never imagined you being a doctor!”
sentences.chinese: 茱莉亞脫口而出，“我還真不知道你還是個醫生。”

sentences.english: "It has become more than a show, " Chen says.
sentences.chinese: “這個節目已不僅僅是一場脫口秀，”陳魯豫說。

sentences.english: A job interview is a one-direction conversation, like on a talk show。
sentences.chinese: 工作面試是單向的談話，像脫口秀一樣。

sentences.english: The world is tired of the death blurting out or muttering again and again.
sentences.chinese: 世界厭倦透了脫口而出或再三沉吟的死亡。

sentences.english: But after finishing saying, again to displeased the words that blurt in times before not already.
sentences.chinese: 可是說完之後，又對先前脫口說出的話懊惱不已。

definition: (of a girl) to feign anger coquettishly
to blurt out/to let slip (an indiscreet remark)
(onom.) coarse crowing/hoarse/husky
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
stupefied/flabbergasted
to mumble/to mutter to oneself
to bid farewell/to part (usually with little hope of meeting again)
to cry out in fear
to contempt/to disdain/pejorative
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
resentful/angry/to enrage sb
to be surprised/to be amazed/to be stunned
pun/play on words
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
calm and composed (idiom)
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
